body_html:
1. Your example makes shape [3, 3] become shape [9]. This is NOT the opposite of expand_dims. As said in the API document, expand_dims "Inserts a dimension of 1 into a tensor's shape.".

  2. tf.squeeze is an opposite of expand_dims. As mentioned in the API document.
    https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/expand_dims
body_text:
Your example makes shape [3, 3] become shape [9]. This is NOT the opposite of expand_dims. As said in the API document, expand_dims "Inserts a dimension of 1 into a tensor's shape.".


tf.squeeze is an opposite of expand_dims. As mentioned in the API document.
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/expand_dims
body:
1. Your example makes shape [3, 3] become shape [9]. This is NOT the opposite of `expand_dims`. As said in the API document, `expand_dims` "__Inserts__ a dimension of 1 into a tensor's shape.".

2. `tf.squeeze` is an opposite of `expand_dims`. As mentioned in the API document.
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/expand_dims
